name: Oldies But Goodies, Pre-70s Mixture Quiz | Music | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who had a number one hit in 1972 with 'My Ding-A-Ling'?
questions.explanation:
Chuck Berry.

	Chuck Berry also had hits with 'Maybellene', 'Roll Over Beethoven' and 'Johnny Be Good' among others.

questions.text: 'I Can't Get No Satisfaction' was knocked out of the US Billboard number one spot by what song?
questions.explanation:
'I'm Henry the Eighth I Am'.

	There are many different variations on the name of this Herman's Hermits hit.

questions.text: Whose back up band was known as 'The Silver Bullet Band'?
Who originally had a hit with 'Wild Thing'?
Who had a 1964 hit with 'Do Wah Diddy Diddy'?
What group did Tony Butala, Jim Pike and Bob Engemann form in 1960?
questions.explanation:
The Lettermen.

	In 1961 they had their first major hit with 'The Way You Look Tonight'.

questions.text: What instrument can Aretha Franklin play?
Clyde McPhatter was the original lead singer of the Drifters.
What was the name of Frankie Valli's original group?
questions.explanation:
Variatones.

	They started singing in the mid fifties. In 1967 Frankie had two hits on the charts at the same time, One as a soloist and one with the group.'Can't Take My Eyes Off Of You' and 'C'mon Marianne'.

questions.text: 'Be Bop A Lula' was on the charts in 1956. Who put it there?
questions.explanation:
Gene Vincent.

	He was the lead vocal with a group called 'The Blue Caps'.
